definition: to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon

sentences.english: Chinese Hamsters were introduced into the UK pet market in the 1960s.
sentences.chinese: 二十世紀六十年代被引進到英國寵物市場。

sentences.english: Something happened in the late 1950s and early ’60s.
sentences.chinese: 五十年代末六十年代初有不少這種事。

sentences.english: Containerization was first introduced in international trade in the 1960s.
sentences.chinese: 集裝箱化是六十年代引入國際貿易的。

sentences.english: Winkle pickers were the second generation rockers and very much the property of the early sixties generation.
sentences.chinese: 尖頭鞋是第二代搖滾人的服飾，流行於六十年代早期。

sentences.english: The second American feminist movement began in the 1960s.
sentences.chinese: 第二次美國婦女運動始於二十世紀六十年代中期。

sentences.english: Don't blame Honeywell—blame the computing world of the 1960s.
sentences.chinese: 別怪霍尼韋爾，更別怪二十世紀六十年代的計算機界。

sentences.english: At the same time, that back catalogue has created its own set of problems, and did so even in the Sixties.
sentences.chinese: 同時，專輯製作有了一些改變，在六十年代就是如此。

sentences.english: At the beginning of sixty time cut a striking figure painting, after study at the Xi'an Academy of Fine Arts.
sentences.chinese: 六十年代初在畫壇嶄露頭角，後深造於西安美術學院。

sentences.english: This can all sound a little like, well, ’60s-style utopianism.
sentences.chinese: 這聽起來可能會有點像六十年代式的烏托邦。

sentences.english: In the halcyon Sixties, that was the sum total of post-graduation anxiety syndrome.
sentences.chinese: 在平靜的六十年代，那就是畢業生焦慮的一切。

sentences.english: Mr Hsu started his career as a teacher in early 1960s.
sentences.chinese: 徐先生早於六十年代初期已開始其教學工作。

sentences.english: TV's Sixties revival has also had an impact.
sentences.chinese: 電視上的六十年代復古風也有一定影響力。

sentences.english: A platform extending outdoors from a floor of a house or an apartment building.
sentences.chinese: 許多難看的公寓式建築羣都是六十年代建造的。

sentences.english: The airborne magnetic gradiometer came into use in the middle 1960s.
sentences.chinese: 航空磁梯度儀在六十年代中期交付使用。

sentences.english: Sixties, that was the sum total of post-graduation anxiety syndrome.
sentences.chinese: 在平靜的六十年代，那就是畢業生焦慮的一切。

sentences.english: This is certainly true of the period we call "the sixties.
sentences.chinese: 這對於我們所說的“六十年代”來說尤其正確。

definition: beginning of an age/beginning of a decade
Cultural Revolution (1966-76)/abbr. for 文化大革命[Wen2 hua4 Da4 ge2 ming4]
after liberation (i.e. after the Communist's victory)/after the establishment of PRC in 1949
early part (of a decade, century etc)/the first years
a decade of a century (e.g. the Sixties)/age/era/period/CL:個|个[ge4]
to work in the fields (esp. young school-leavers)/forced agricultural experience for city intellectuals
the late Qing and early Republic, i.e. China around 1911
Great Leap Forward (1958-1960), Mao's attempt to modernize China's economy, which resulted in economic devastation, and millions of deaths from famine caused by misguided policies
the Four Cleanups Movement (1963-66), which aimed to cleanse the politics, economy, organization and ideology of the Communist Party
